The Calle Bolívar communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Cantón.  The canton is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are known on a national and international level.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat. 

This is a group of nine members and two other members who decided to join together to form this communal bank.  The bank has served them well because they were able to improve their businesses with the loans that they received.  The members devote themselves to different business activities like general commerce, handicrafts, services, food sales, and other businesses.

Rosa is one of the members of this group.  She is 34 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has four children, ages 16, 13, 7, and 4.  The three oldest go to high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a master welder.

She is a very good housewife.  In order to help her husband with the household expenses she sells all types of clothes.  She sells door-to-door.  She works from Fridays through Sundays because this is when she can meet with her customers, and it is when she sells the most.  She also collects on these days because she leaves clothes on credit and collects weekly.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise each time she needs it.  She has been doing this business activity for over five years.  It has gone very well for her.  Now it is better since she is receiving the loans.

This loan is to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.  She has been in the communal bank since it started, and she likes it because of the help it has offered her in order to get ahead and increase her business.  Her dream is to continue increasing her sales.

The small photo is of one of the members who for personal reasons was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, t shirts, blouses, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Alexandra Flor

texts.es:
Alexandra Flor tiene 23 años es soltera vive sus padres, no tiene hijos. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La ventanilla se llama PITA se encuentra ubicada En el Recinto San Pablo de Pita perteneciente al Canton Caluma a 45 minutos de Montalvo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. 

Alexandra se dedica a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo, naranja y cafe ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en Comercial San Rafael en Caluma y las vende en Montalvo. 

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Alexandra es comprar un terreno.


En las fiestas de carnaval le gusta salir en las comparsas.
texts.en: Alexandra Flor is 23 years old, single, lives with her parents, and has no children. She lives in Montalvo, Province of Los Ríos. The communal bank is called PITA and is located in Recinto San Pablo de Pita belonging to the Caluma Canton 45 minutes away from Montalvo. This bank devotes itself to agricultural labors, tending to crops of oranges, bananas, orito (wild bananas), cocoa and coffee. Alexandra devotes herself to tending crops of cocoa, bananas, oranges and coffee since these are long-cycle products. She makes her purchases at Comercial San Rafael in Caluma and sells in Montalvo. She is requesting her loan for purchase supplies such as fertilizers, plant nutrients, and for pruning and ridding the ground of weeds and avoiding diseases in the crops. The loans have helped her improve the quality of her product and avoid losses of the crops. Alexandra's dream is to purchase some land. During Carnival season she likes to go out dressed up in costume with a group.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, plant nutrients, and for pruning and ridding the ground of weeds and avoiding diseases in the crops.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is 27 years old and married to Elizabeth. They have been blessed with one child. He is a vendor and sells new clothes. Through his hard work, he has been able to provide for his family’s needs. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more new clothes for sale in order to satisfy his customers' needs.

In the future, Collins hopes to expand his clothing business and later diversify to a motorbike transportation business. This will enable him to earn more income and buy a vehicle for his transportation business.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru: Гулхумор замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Более 10 лет она занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев. Она шьет на заказ. Кроме этого она занимается купле- продажей скота. Имеет 4 голов крупного рогатого скота. Гулхумор хотела бы получить займ для ремонта своего дома, с целью улучшения жилищных условий. Гулхумор надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Gulkhumor is married and a loving mother of two children.  She has been involved in sewing women's national dresses for over ten years.  She sews to order.  Besides this, she is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She has four heads of cattle.  Gulkhumor wants to obtain this loan to repair her house in order to improve living conditions.  Gulkhumor relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Etibar

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek kak vi videte na fotograrii zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Etibar 29 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey odin iz kotorix xodit v shkolku. Etibar jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i detmi. On 4 qoda nazad nachal zanimatsya pticevodstvom. Etibar nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On xochet v budushem uvelichit pomesheniye svoyey fermi i svoy bizness. Etomu biznessu Etibar nauchilsya u svoyego starshego brata.
texts.en: This young person, as you can see on the photograph, is involved in poultry farming and breeds chickens.  Etibar is 29 years old, married and has two children, one of whom attends a school.  Etibar lives in the Baku region together with his beloved wife and children.  He became involved in poultry farming four years ago.  Etibar needs 1000 AZN to buy chickens in order to develop his business.  He wants to expand his farm space and his business in the future.  Etibar learned this business from his older brother.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou est marié et âgé de vingt huit ans. Père d’un enfant il vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et son enfant à Ouelessebougou.
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans réussite, il décida de s’initier aux activités d’achat et de vente d’articles de quincaillerie.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires, il intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Actuellement il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier.
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt, une quantité importante d’articles de quincaillerie constitués : d’ampoules, de serrures, de peinture, de fer à béton et de ciment à Bamako, qu’il stock dans son magasin et vend au marché de Ouelessebougou, aux hommes et femmes. Il mène son activité durant toute l’année et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois.
Il espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000 F CFA par mois qu’il compte utiliser pour résoudre les dépenses de sa famille et investir dans son activité commerciale.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou is a married 28-year-old.  The father of one child, he lives in a monogamous family with his wife and child in Ouelessebougou.  After unsuccessfully trying several business, he decided to begin retailing hardware items.  In search of additional financial resources, he joined Soro Yiriwaso's credit program.  He is currently on his second individual loan after paying back the first without difficulty.

With this loan, Mr. Seydou plans to buy a large quantity of hardware items, including light bulbs, locks, paint, concrete rebar, and cement in Bamako, which he will stock in his store and sell in the Ouelessebougou market.  His customers include both men and women.  He operates his business year-round and buys his products twice a month.

Mr. Seydou hopes to make a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA, which he plans to use to cover his family's expenses and to invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Chicas De Azucar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS DE AZUCAR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de de Villa Adela.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes y cuentan con una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la misma se encuentra  la señora Jenny. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejedora de mantas, reparación de cámaras fotográficas, venta de bidones, trenzado de mantas, tienda de polainas, venta de antenas, tejedora de guantes, costura de deportivos, venta de comida.

La señora Jenny, indica que inicia en la conformación de una asociación comunal desde este ciclo y que en la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de taller de microelectrónica, que viene trabajando hace años aprendiendo el mismo de su familia. El crédito de este ciclo es para ampliación de su mercadería (compra de repuesto de electrónica) que las ferias paceñas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su taller de reparaciones. Esta forma de trabajo le permite apoyar a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta lel área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank ‘Chicas de Azucar’ will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the regional office in Villa Adela.  It is made up of 9 members and has a board of directors at the head, where you will find Jenny. The work that the members of the community bank carry out is quite varied. Among them we have a blanket weaver, camera repairs, the sale of oil cans, a maker of braided blankets, a shop selling gaiters, the sale of aerials, a glove maker, the stitching of sneakers and food sales.

Jenny points out that she became part of a communal bank with this loan. She currently has a microelectronics workshop, which she has been working in for years, learning it from her family. This loan is to increase her merchandise (purchase of electronic parts) which she buys in the markets in La Paz, and subsequently will market it in her repair shop. This way of working allows her to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health section.

loans.use: to buy electronic parts.

loans.name: Mireille

texts.en:
Mireille, age 42, is married, with one 22-year-old daughter. She also cares and provides for one orphaned nephew, and a niece and a nephew whose parents are not able to support them. 
Mireille makes and sells clothes and knits children's clothes. She also makes and sells homemade yogurt in her shop. She plans on using the loan to buy ingredients for yogurt and knitting materials, and to make a payment on her new knitting machine. Mireille was able to pay for most of the knitting machine with a past loan, but still owes a little on it. She hopes to buy an additional sewing machine with a future loan as her business continues to grow. 
Her experience and skills in sewing and knitting are the keys to her success. She has been sewing and knitting since 1984. She has acquired many loyal customers. 
Mireille has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She wishes to continue to use the loans to expand her business and eventually wants to open a sewing school. She now trains women in her shop who wish to learn, but wants a more formal school setting in the future. Her daughter is currently in college to become a doctor. Mireille hopes she can continue to support her daughter as she pursues her dream.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients for yogurt, knitting materials, and the payments on her new knitting machine.

loans.name: George Mutahi

texts.en:
George has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for 12 years now. This will be his third loan. He paid his previous full loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use this amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting during this planting season. 

He also plans to use the loan amount to buy spraying chemicals, as well as for labour. In the future, George hopes to become a large-scale farmer and thereby become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Akech

texts.en: Akech, a 28-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, lives in Bor where she has operated a food stall for a year. Akech, who heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is now requesting her first loan for 500 SDG to purchase onions and sugar. She will use the resulting extra money to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel Angel tiene 57 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos tiene 2 hijos. Vive en Montalvo Provincia de Los Ríos. 

La ventanilla se llama PITA se encuentra ubicada En el Recinto San Pablo de Pita perteneciente al Canton Caluma a 45 minutos de Montalvo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café. 

Miguel se dedica a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo y cafe ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en Comercial San Rafael en Caluma y las vende en Montalvo. 

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como:abonos, urea y fungicidas para la malesa o mala herva, ranger para las enfermedades en los cultivos . El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Miguel es compara as terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en: Miguel Angel is 57 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children. He lives in Montalvo, Province of Los Ríos. The communal bank is called PITA and is located in Recinto San Pablo de Pita belonging to the Caluma Canton 45 minutes away from Montalvo. This bank devotes itself to agricultural labors, tending to crops of oranges, bananas, orito (wild bananas), cocoa and coffee. Miguel devotes himself to tending crops of cocoa, bananas, and coffee since these are long-cycle products. He makes his purchases at Comercial San Rafael in Caluma and sells in Montalvo. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies such as fertilizer, urea, fungicides and Ranger for weeds, brush and crop diseases. The loans have helped him improve the quality of his product and avoid losses of the crops. Miguel’s dream is to purchase some land in order to continue growing crops. He likes to play sports with his friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, urea, fungicides and Ranger for weeds, brush and crop diseases.

loans.name: Jamodere

texts.en:
Jamodere is married, with two children aged 5 and 7. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for one year. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and make savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and labor support.

loans.name: Muema

texts.en: Muema, a 40-year-old married father blessed with two children, has been engaged in auto repair for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES.30,000. With a good credit history, Muema is now applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD. to buy a welding machine and lubrication oil. He hopes to open a retail shop for his wife and a garage for himself in the future.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine and lubrication oil.

loans.name: Abiar

texts.en:
Abiar lives in Bor. She sells charcoal and has been in business for two years. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Abiar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sosorburam

texts.en:
Sosorburam is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three girls in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. Her husband is a plumber and the three girls are at college. 
Since 2008 Sosorburam has been making traditional clothes in wintertime and building decorations in summertime. Her husband helps her sometimes. They have been earning income for the family and paying the three girls' college fees. Now Sosorburam plans to expand the business by buying the necessary materials, such as cotton and silk, to make traditional clothes and sell them at the shop counter where she has been working for a few years.
Sosorburam is a good-natured woman who says: "I would like to expand the business by getting the supplies in large amounts. I have a further plan to expand more and more to earn extra for my daughters' future." 
The total amount Sosorburam is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase cotton and silk.

loans.use: to purchase cotton and silk.

loans.name: Mariana Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 47 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de catorce y tres años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

María se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.  

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, urea, liquidos para desinfectar los cultivos, ferlitizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es seguir trabanjo para tener un poco mas de dineropara ayudar a los hijos.

Le gusta jugar con los hijos.
texts.en:
María, 47, is married living with her husband and two children who are 14 and 3 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. She is a member of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading toward the Future) communal bank, located in Jesús de Gran Poder, Ventanas Canton. 

María works on short cycle farming growing corn and rice. She buys her supplies at the Marlín supply center, selling also in that community and in Ventanas. She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, and crop disinfectants and fertilizers. The loan will support her to meet her financial needs and to face challenges like crop diseases and infestations. Her dream is to keep on working and to have a little more money to help her children. 

She likes to play with her children.

loans.use: to purchase urea, disinfectant liquids and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase perfumes, eyeshadows, blush, lipsticks and creams.

loans.name: Jose Obdulio

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo con el objetivo de mejorar su inventario y comprar cocos de esa manera siempre tendrá para atender la venta, el cual le ayudaran para aumentar en sus ganancias.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo porque lo invertio todo en la compra de mercadería y con las ganancias logro ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan with the goal of increasing his inventory and purchasing coconuts, thus he will always have enough to sell. This will help him boost profits.

He thinks that the previous loan helped him because he invested it all in purchasing merchandise, and with the profits, he was able to help his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts.

loans.name: Evazi

texts.en:
Evazi is married and has four children aged between 4 and 10. All are enrolled in school. His wife works as a farmer. He has been a rice farmer for four years. He would like to get this Kiva loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and support labor to get the best harvest. With the profits, he plans to expand the area he has been using to get more output and also renovate the house. 

In the background of the picture, fellow agriculture borrowers are shown waiting for the photographer.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and labor support.

loans.name: Abiar

texts.en:
Abiar lives in Bor. She is 26 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. Abiar runs a food stall, and has been in this business for one year. 
Abiar heard about Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC South Sudan. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya. He is 62 and married with nine children, the last three of whom are of school-going age. He has been in farming for 39 years, mainly producing maize but currently producing vegetables as well in order to improve his family's life.
Robert has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He will use the extra income to educate his children. He goal is to own five dairy cows in five years.
Robert says poor road networks and common animal diseases are the major challenges he faces in the farming business.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Azamatjon

texts.ru: Азаматчон трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 4лет он занимается купле- продажей легковых автомашин. Имеет много покупателей и его бизнес идет хорошо. Кроме этого он летом перерабатывает абрикос. Азаматчон запрашивает займ, чтобы построить фундамент и стену. Он очень надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Azamatjon is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and raising two children.  Azamatjon has been involved in buying and selling passenger cars for over four years.  He has many customers, and his business is going well.  Besides this, he process apricots in the summer.  Azamatjon is requesting this loan to build a foundation and wall.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to build a house foundation and wall

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.ru: Sevindj jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Sevindj 45 let. Ona ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. Sevindj uje 7 let kak imeyet svoy aptek gde sama i rabotayet. Ona seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye Apteka tak kak on xochet pomestit tam bolshe tovarov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami kotoraya toje v molodosti zanimalas etim delom.
texts.en:
Sevindj lives in the Baku region together with her family. She is married and has three children. She is 45 years old, and a hardworking person. 

Sevindj has owned her pharmacy, where she also works, for seven years. She currently needs 2000 AZN in order to enlarge the premises of the pharmacy, as she wants to put in more products. She learned this business from her mother, who was also engaged in this activity in her youth.

loans.use: to enlarge the premises of her pharmacy

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
María Elba tiene 32 años de edad es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 12,11,10,8,7,5 y 3 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.
se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos,urea, líquidos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un solar y hacer una casa para poder vivir con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y viajar.
texts.en:
Maria Elba is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and kids of ages: 12, 11, 10, 8, 7, 5, and 3.  They live in Ventanas canton,  Los Rios province.

The communal group, VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro ( Progressing towards the future ) are located in Jesus de gran Poder (Jesus of Great Power), a settlement in Ventanas. They are dedicated to short-cycle agricultural activities, sowing corn and rice. They buy their products in Comercial Marlin and sell their crops in the same location in Ventanas. 
Maria Elba is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, liquids, and fertilizers for her crops.The loan will help her economically to supply necessities and confront challenges such as plant plagues and illnesses. Maria Elba's dream is to be able to buy a lot and build a house where she and her family can live.In her free time she likes to go for walks and travel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, products, urea, fertilizer, and liquids

loans.name: Torrent De Kerith Plus Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Torrent de Kerith Plus”. It is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Beatrice is a 56-year-old widow. She is the mother of six children aged between 23 and 38 years old; three of them go to school. She has been active in her business since 2005. She sells corn seeds and salted fish in the western area of Kinshasa. She has already taken nine loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. Thanks to Hope’s loans, her business has prospered and it generates a profit of about USD $60 per week. With this loan Beatrice intends to increase the inventory of her business by buying some sacks of corn seeds to resell at profit and increase her income. Her ambition is to diversify her business and become a provider in her environment. She works hard in order to achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn seeds for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en:
Kakhaber is 33 years old. He lives in the village of Mashnaari, East Georgia, with his wife Mariam and his mother. Kakhaber and his mother earn a living through trade. Kakhaber’s mother sells greengrocery products at the local market. Kakhaber trades in clothing in a nearby small town. He purchases clothing at wholesale markets and sells it for a higher price. His family's total average monthly income is 900 Laris (GEL).
Kakhaber has requested credit to increase the stock in his trade business. He will diversify the assortment of clothing in his store and attract additional customers. This will result in increased sales, as well as increasing the family's income. Kakhaber hopes that with increased income he will be able to make some savings to renovate the family house, as it isn’t renovated and needs some repairs to become comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a father of four children with the youngest two still attending school. He has been in farming for 20 years and currently employs one farmhand. He produces maize, milk and vegetables for the local market.
Simon has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says this expansion and diversification will provide his family with supplementary food and income to meet other basic needs, mainly the children's education.
Simon is however concerned with the poor road network and animal diseases which eat so much into farmers' incomes.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Neris Jacinta

texts.es:
Neris Jacinta tiene 25 años de edad vive en unión libre, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 3 años de edad en el  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Neris se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, urea, liquidos para cuidar de la maleza y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es coprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Neris Jacinta is 25 years old. She lives with her common-law husband and their 3-year-old daughter in Canton Ventanas, province of Los Rios. She is a member of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Heading toward the Future) communal bank, located in Jesús de Gran Poder, Ventanas Canton. She works on short cycle farming. 
Neris grows corn and rice. She buys her supplies at the Marlín supply center and her sales are also there and in Ventanas. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will provide financial support to meet her needs and face challenges such as pests and diseases. Her dream is to buy land and keep on farming. In her free time she enjoys going for walks and spending more time at work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun, 32, is a responsible mother of five school-aged children. She is a local farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has spent most of her life dedicated to rice farming. Her spouse is in the fishing business and seeks to provide a sustainable living for their children. 
Moeun would like to take out a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase a plot of land from a local villager. She will be able to expand her business through using the Kiva loan. Meoun hopes to get her house repaired someday because some parts of it need fixing due to its old age.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land from a local villager.

loans.name: Dashdulam

texts.en: Mrs. Dashdulam, 50, runs a motel in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a disabled widow and lives with her son. She has been running her business for seven years and tries to develop her business day by day. She is requesting a loan to increase her motel's working capital in order to purchase beds and other furniture. She will be able to increase her business capacity and receive many more bookings providing that she increases her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her motel.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 34-year-old farmer from the village of Akhasheni, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Marine, eight-year-old son and retired parents. Zurab’s son goes to a local school. Zurab and Marine earn a living through agriculture. They have a dairy cow and a calf. Marine makes cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, the family owns 0.4 hectares of vineyard. Zurab produces wine and sells it in the village as well. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris (GEL), including the monthly pensions of Zurab’s parents. 
Zurab has requested credit to purchase feed for the cow. He will feed the cow with natural food and increase its productivity. Accordingly, the family will produce more cheese and make more income. They will be able to spend more on family needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his cow.

loans.name: Colombe Plus Group

texts.en:
Fabien is the chairman of the Community Bank “Colombe Plus”, which is composed of 21 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 
Fabien is 57 years old and the father of seven children aged between 12 and 32 years old, four of whom go to school. Fabien sells beverages. He started this business in 1987. With the profit generated and good management, he increased his working capital. Fabien intends to use this loan to increase his inventory by buying mineral water and some crates of beverages to resell at a profit and to reinforce his working capital. His business brings in USD $90 of profit per week.

loans.use: to buy mineral water and crates of beverages.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр – из Приветного. Он – фермер. Александр выращивает ранние культуры на своем участке в 88 соток. У него есть теплицы, с хорошими крепкими дугами, где он выращивает 20 000 голов капусты, 50 000 перца, 5 тонн морковь, 5 тонн свеклы и 70 000 штук лука. Александр занимается сельским хозяйством уже 4 года. В хозяйство у него вложено около 80 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль - немногим больше 7 000 гривен в месяц. 

Александр планирует вложить 16 000 гривен в закупку семян, пленки, удобрений, дров, а также в строительство дополнительной теплицы у себя на участке.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alexander is from the town Privetnoye. He is a farmer. Alexander grows early crops on his plot of 88 acres. He has greenhouses with good and strong frames, where he grows 20 000 cabbage heads, 50 000 peppers, 5 tons of carrots, 5 tons of beetroot and 70 000 onions. 

Alexander has already been engaged in farming for four years. He has invested around 80 000 hryvnia in the farm. The net income is a bit more than 7 000 hryvnia per month. Alexander plans to invest 16 000 hryvnia to purchase seeds, plastic covering, fertilizer, wood and also to build an additional greenhouse on his plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic covering, fertilizers and wood and to build an additional greenhouse

loans.name: Angela Marilu

texts.es:
Angela Marilú tiene 28 años de edad es soltera, vive con los papás y con la hija de 3 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.Es renovacion  del credito.

Angela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos en un mejor precio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprarse un solar y poder hacer una casa para poder vivir con la fa,ilia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Angela Marilú is a 28-year-old single woman who lives with her parents and 3-year-old daughter in Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

She is a member of the VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro (Walking Towards the Future) group, which is located in Jesús de gran Poder, a part of the Ventanas canton. She works in short-term agriculture, cultivating corn and rice. She is renewing the loan.

Since Angela grows corn and rice, she buys products from the Comercial Marlin Market, and she sells her produce both at this market and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and other fertilizers to keep her crops in good condition so that she can then sell them at a better price. This loan will help her out financially so that she can cover her expenses and deal with the challenges of farming, such as pests and plant diseases. Her dream is to be able to purchase a plot of land and build a home in which she and her family can live.

In her free time, she likes to go out and have fun, as well as spend more time working.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, liquids, urea, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin is 28 years old and a married man who is responsible for two single school-aged children, living in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Chhin works  providing a horse-drawn transportation service to local people in his community. He uses his horse-trailer to carry rice, vegetables and other goods across the commune. From this business, he is able to generate an average of USD 2.50 per day. 

Chhin is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a young strong horse so he can run his business smoothly. Through using this loan, Chhin will be able to provide his children with basic necessities and comfortable living conditions. He’s very grateful.

loans.use: to purchase a young strong horse to help him run his business smoothly.

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Han, 46 years old, is a humble villager from Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is in the business of rice husbandry, from which she is able to earn her daily livelihood. Her husband also works in this type of business to share his responsibilities. Han has been blessed with five children, three of whom are students and depend on her income.

With the sum of KHR 4,200,000, Han plans to plant a type of beans on her own farmland. She will buy seed and mineral fertilizers as well pesticide to protect her crops from the challenge of insects. Han’s dream is to expand the size of her farmland and thereby she can increase her output and her income.

loans.use: to plant a type of beans on her own farmland.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 40 years old. She is married with three children. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET LTD client. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of clothes for sale in her business.

Her hope is to own a wholesale shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old. She is married to Robert and together they have four children. She operates a greengrocery and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first term loan. She was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET client. She will use the loan amount to purchase vegetables to stock for resale.

She hopes to own a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a 37-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a retail shop that he started five years back. His main challenge is high transportation costs, price fluctuations and inflation. His dream is educating his children to higher levels, expanding his business into a wholesale shop, and buying land for crop growing. Jackson needs this loan to buy land for crop growing.

loans.use: to buy land for crop growing.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир с супругой и тремя дочерьми проживает в селе Тарасовка. Он занимается выращиванием ранних сельхоз культур. У Владимира есть более 1 гектара земли в теплицах, под дугами и агроволокном. На этом участке земли он выращивает 2 тонны редиса, 20 000 голов капусты, 50 000 штук лука, 30 000 перца, 30 000 баклажан, 40 000 сельдерея, 50 000 свеклы, 2 тонны кабачков,5 000 кустов помидор и 6 тонн картофеля в год. Работает фермером Владимир уже 15 лет. Богатый опыт и интерес к тепличному делу помог ему достичь больших оборотов в этом бизнесе: в хозяйство Владимир вложил около 100 000 гривен. 

Владимиру необходим кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы купить семена, пленку, удобрения и систему капельного орошения для весеннего сезона. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vladimir, his wife and their three daughters live in the Tarasovka region. He is engaged in growing early crops. 

Vladimir has more than one hectare of greenhouse land, under the frames and plastic covers. On this plot of land he grows 2 tons of radishes, 20 000 cabbage heads, 50 000 onions, 30 000 peppers, 30 000 egg plants, 40 000 celeries, 50 000 beetroots, 2 tons of zucchini, 5 000 tomatoes and 6 tons of potatoes per year. 

Vladimir has been a farmer for more than 15 years. Rich experience and interest in the greenhouse business helped him achieve high turnover in this business. He invested around 100 000 hryvnia in the farm. Vladimir needs a loan of 20 000 hryvnia in order to purhcase seeds, plastic cover, fertilizers and a drip irrigation system for the spring season.

loans.use: to purhcase seeds, plastic cover, fertilizers and a drip irrigation system for the spring season

loans.name: Wilson Raul

texts.es:
Wilson Raul tiene 33 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Wilson se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener algún día una casa para poder darsela a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Wilson Raul is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 2 children, ages 7 and 10, in Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

He is a member of the VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro (Walking Towards the Future) group, which is located in Jesús de gran Poder, a part of the Ventanas canton. He works in short-term agriculture, cultivating corn and rice.

Since Wilson grows corn and rice, he buys products from the Comercial Marlin Market, and he sells his produce both at this market and in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and other fertilizers for his crops. This loan will help him out financially so that he can cover his expenses and deal with the challenges of farming, such as pests and plant diseases. His dream is to be able to one day own a home, which he will give to his children.

In his free time, he likes to go out and have fun, as well as spend more time working.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, liquids, urea, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olivia, está solicitando un préstamo para fortalecer el negocio, pues quiere comprar ropa nueva como blusas, faldas, short, calcetines, con esta nueva inversión estará mejorando la disponibilidad de prendas de vestir para atender la demanda.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, lo que le ha permitido generar más ganancias para su familia y poder superarse.
texts.en:
Olivia is applying for a loan to strengthen her business because she wants to purchase new clothing such as  blouses, skirts, shorts and socks. With this new investment she will improve the availability of garments to meet the demand.

She has had a good experience with her earlier loan, which has enabled her to generate more income for her family and to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, shorts and socks.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a 28-year-old single hard-working woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a boutique where she sells both new and second-hand clothes. Her challenge is high transportation costs and failure of customers to pay on time. Her business dream is moving into a more permanent location and expanding her business into  a boutique that is well-known around town. Scovia needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, se dedica a la venta de artefactos electrónicos de forma independiente, ya que no cuenta con un lugar de venta fijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más artefactos para aumentar su clientela y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Pablo, es soltero y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en una casa en anticretico en la zona Miraflores la misma ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Pablo sells electronic devices in an independent manner.  He does not have a fixed sales location.

The loan he needs is to buy more devices in order to get more customers.  This way he will improve his income in order to help his family.

Pablo is single, and he has two children.  He lives with them in an “anticretico”  arrangement (Anticretico is a transaction not available in the U.S. whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you) in the Miraflores zone in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more electronic devices.

loans.name: Anibal Medardo

texts.es:
Anibal Medardo tiene 22 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Anibal se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar una camioneta para poder transportar los productos que cultiva para salir a venderlos y no pagar flete.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Anibal Medardo, 22 is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas canton in Los Rios province.

The communal bank "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" is located in the Jesús de Gran Poder settlement in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short cycle agriculture cultivating corn and rice.

Anibal works as a farmer, and he cultivates corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Marlin shopping center, and he sells his produce in the same location and also in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, liquids (such as liquid fertilizers and pesticides), urea and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to stock up with the supplies he needs.  He faces challenges in farming, such as diseases and pests that affect his crops.  His dream is to be able to buy a vehicle to transport the products he cultivates so that he could get them to the market without having to pay transportation fees.

In his free time he enjoys getting out and about.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizers

loans.name: Franklin Michael

texts.es:
Franklin Michael tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los papás en el  en el Cantón Ventanas
 Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Franklin se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Franklin Michael is 21 yers old and single and does not have children. He lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios Province. The members of Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank are located in Jesus de Gran Poder Precinct, belonging to Ventanas Canton and engage in sort cycle agriculture, cultivating corn and rice.

Franklin farms corn and rice. He buys his supplies in Comercial Morlin and sells them at the same place and in Ventanas. 

He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizer for his plants. The loan would help him financially to stock the necessities. He confronts challenges such as pests and diseases. Franklin’s dream is to be able to own his own land in order to be able to work better.

In his free time he enjoys going for walks and spending more time working.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a produce store that he started in 2008. He started his business with just 250,000 shillings and now it's worth 1,000,000 shillings.

Despite the fact that Moses is progressing, his major challenge has been price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house, whereas his business dream is buying land to grow crops and expanding his business into new markets. Moses needs this loan to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en: Herbert is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has a produce store that he started 8 years back. His starting capital was 1 million but now it's worth 3 million shillings. In spite of his progress, Herbert faces a challenge of price fluctuations and inflation of agricultural produce. His desire is to educate his children and expand his business into new markets. He needs this loan to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 35 years old. He is married with three children. He sells eggs and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his first loan. He was brought to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan amount to purchase bicycles to distribute eggs to different locations.


He hopes to acquire a truck to aid in distribution.

loans.use: to purchase bicycles to distribute eggs to different locations.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена вложила заемные средства, полученные от КИВА в последний раз, в пополнение сезонного ассортимента товара. 
Елена надеется использовать кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить одежду весеннего ассортимента для последующей его реализации на рынке. За счет увеличения уровня продаж она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль, развивать бизнес и дальше, а также приобрести необходимую бытовую технику и улучшать быт семьи.
texts.en:
Yelena has invested the borrowed funds that she received from Kiva the previous time to restock the seasonal assortment of products. 

Yelena hopes to use a Kiva loan in the amount of 20 000 hryvnia in order to purchase spring clothing to sell at the market. By increasing the level of sales she hopes to get extra income to develop her business even further and also to purchase necessary household appliances to improve her family's daily life.

loans.use: to purchase spring clothing to sell at the market

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme âgé(e) de 42 ans. Elle est mariée. 
Akou travaille comme revendeuse d’articles de mercerie et des pagnes depuis 2006. Elle sert seule ses clients dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Akou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de mercerie et des pagnes. Elle veut s’épanouir.
texts.en: Akou is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married.  She has been reselling sewing supplies and pagnes (colorful West African fabrics) since 2006.  She buys her merchandise in Lomé and works alone in a shop, where she attends to her customers.  Akou is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy sewing supplies and fabrics.  She wants to thrive.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and fabrics.

loans.name: Oshualdo

texts.es:
Oshualdo, es productor de leche y artesano costurero, trabaja confeccionando  ropa deportiva.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para incrementar la producción de leche y de esta forma obtener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Oshualdo, es casado y tiene un hijo, viven en Achacachi  la cual se encuentra en el departamento de  de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO  y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Oshualdo is a dairy farmer, craftsman and tailor; he works manufacturing sportswear.  He needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production to obtain more income to help his family.  Oshualdo is married and has a son.  They live in Achacachi which is located in La Paz Department.  This is the second time he's worked with IMPRO and the first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara Elizabeth tiene 39 años de edad es soltera vive con los tres hijos de 11, 8,3 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Sara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comparse una casa para poder vivir tranquila con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Sara Elizabeth is a 39-year-old single mother who lives with her 3 children, ages 11, 8, an 3, in Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

She is a member of VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro (Walking Towards the Future), which is located in Jesús de gran Poder, a part of the Ventanas canton. She works in short-term agriculture, cultivating corn and rice.

Since Sara grows corn and rice, she buys products from the Comercial Marlin Market, and she sells her produce both at this market and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and other fertilizers to keep her crops in good condition so that she can then sell them at a better price. This loan will help her out financially so that she can cover her expenses and deal with the challenges of farming, such as pests and plant diseases. Her dream is to be able to purchase a home in which she will able to leave peacefully with her children.

In her free time, she likes to go out and have fun, as well as spend more time working.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking young married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has a boutique that she started two years ago. Her business challenges include high fuel and transportation costs, price inflation and the seasonal nature of her products. Her dream is to educate her children, build a permanent home, buy land to grow crops and expand her business into other places. Agnes needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi est  un homme âgé de 45 ans. Il est marié à une coiffeuse et a 03enfants.
Komi fait des copies et des reliures aux clients depuis 1999. Il exerce seul son activité dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Komi a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une machine photocopieuse. Il veut s’investir dans l’activité  et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Komi is 45 years old and married to a hairdresser.  He has three children.
He has been providing photocopying and binding services since 1999.  He buys his supplies in  Lomé and works alone in a shop.
Komi has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy a photocopy machine.  He wants to invest in his activity and see his family thrive.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
Digna Patricia tiene 22 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de 5, 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Digna Patricia is 22 years old, is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are 5 and 8 years old.  She lives in Ventanas Canton, de los Ríos Province.

The members of the communal bank "Caminando Hacia el Futuro" (Walking Toward the Future), located in Jesús de gran Poder Precinct, Ventanas Canton, make their livings in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice.

Digna makes her living in agriculture, planting corn and rice.  She purchases her products in Marlín's Store and makes her sales there as well as in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquid fertilizers, urea and fertilizer for her crops.  The loan will help her to meet her needs financially and to face challenges, such as plagues and disease.  Digna's dream is to be able to have her own plot of land to better be able to work.

In her free time, Digna likes to go for walks and to dedicate more time to her work.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, supplies, liquid fertilizers, urea and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere continuar invirtiendo en el negocio, con la compra de ropa nueva, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, entre otras prendas de vestir que sean demandadas para poder generar ventas.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo con el negocio, mejorando su condición de comerciante y manteniendo un nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan because she wants to continue investing in her business.  She will purchase new clothing, blouses, skirts, undergarments, pants, shirts and other in-demand garments to be able to generate more sales.
María feels that the previous loan had a positive effect on her business by improving her position as a merchant and allowing her to maintain a certain income.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, undergarments, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old and blessed with five children aged one, three, 13, 19 and 20. She sells green maize wholesale, a business she started 15 years ago. Janet earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She has requested a loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase more green maize for sale. This is her first loan. 

The anticipated profit will help her to educate her children. Her dream is to see her children pursue their education.

loans.use: to purchase green maize for sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a 35-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has owned a school, as well as a grinding machine, for the last eight years. His  major challenge has been having to pay taxes and other fees. His dream is educating his children and also constructing more classrooms so as to have an effective teaching environment. Benjamin needs this loan to construct more classrooms.

loans.use: to construct classrooms.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 38-year-old married woman with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a beauty salon that she started four years ago. She began with capital worth 500,000 shillings, and now her business is worth 800,000 shillings. Despite this progress, she faces a challenge of customers' not paying on time. Her desire is to build a permanent home and expand her business into new markets. Justine needs the loan to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for use in her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shredded, meat, rice, oil, cheese and condiments.

loans.name: Marcos Vinicio

texts.es:
Marcos Vinicio tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Marcos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprarse un terreno y poder hacer una casa para poder vivir tranquilos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcos Vinicio is 19 years old, single, has no children, and lives with his parents in Ventanas Provincia de los Rios.

He is a member of the VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro (Walking Towards the Future) group, which is located in Jesús de gran Poder, a part of the Ventanas canton. He works in short-term agriculture, cultivating corn and rice.

Since Marcos grows corn and rice, he buys products from the Comercial Marlin Market, and he sells his produce both at this market and in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and other fertilizers for his crops. This loan will help him out financially so that he can cover his expenses and deal with the challenges of farming, such as pests and plant diseases. His dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house so that he can live peacefully.

In his free time, he likes to go out and have fun, as well as spend more time working.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, supplies, liquids, urea, and other fertilizers.

loans.name: Moises Arahon

texts.es:
Moisés, quiere seguir trabajando con préstamo, por eso se ha decidido a solicitar otro y con la intención de invertirlo en comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para que sus cosechas sean mejores este año, la compra sera en semilla, abono y fertilizantes de ese modo podrá obtener mejores resultados.
El considera que el crédito anterior le ayudo porque las cosechas fueron muy buenos y su familia vive mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Moisés wants to keep working with loans, which is why he has decided to request another one.  He plans to invest in the purchase of necessary agricultural supplies so that his harvests will be better this year.  He will purchase seeds, manure and fertilizer so that he can have better results.
Moisés feels that the previous loan helped him because his harvests were very good and his family is living a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ri/g/00096 Group

texts.en:
Jean is chairman of a community bank named “Amen Plus,” which is composed of 15 micro entrepreneurs jointly receiving loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Jean has been in the microenterprise world for years. Today, he sells lamp oil in a market located in the northeast of Kinshasa. He is 45 years old, and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 11. All of them go to school. 

His business has prospered, thanks to Hope’s loans. With his profit of about US$40 per week, he intends to use his next loan to increase his inventory.

Jean is happy to be part of one of MFI Hope’s groups. He joined the group in 2010. His business has been supported with the six loans he has received, and repaid, from MFI Hope DRC. His dream is to become a lamp oil provider in his community.

loans.use: to increase his inventory.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima wants a loan to buy braids, weaves, and cosmetics for sale. She has been operating a salon for a couple of years. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. 

Her family dream is to eradicate poverty and live a better life. She desires to expand her salon and sell cosmetics wholesale.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru: Инна использовала последний кредит от КИВА для того, чтобы разнообразить ассортимент сезонного товара. В этот раз Инна обратилась в КИВА за дополнительной финансовой помощью, так как она планирует развиваться, как предприниматель, и дальше и для этого ей необходимы денежные средства. За счет суммы в размере 15 000 гривен она планирует пополнить оборотные средства и закупить чулочные средства для реализации этой весной. За счет получения дополнительной прибыли Инна планирует отдых своей семьи на море, потому что считает, что очень важно уметь и усердно работать, и полноценно отдыхать и оздоровляться.
texts.en:
Inna used her previous loan from Kiva to diversify the assortment of seasonal products. This time Inna turned to Kiva for additional financial help, as she is planning to develop as an entrepreneur and for this she needs the funds. 

With the amount of 15 000 hryvnia Inna plans to replenish working capital and purchase hosiery for reselling this spring. Inna is planning a family vacation by the sea based on the additional profit, because she thinks it is very important both to know how to work hard and how to fully relax and improve one's health.

loans.use: to replenish working capital and purchase hosiery for reselling

loans.name: Humbat

texts.ru: Humbat uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet masterom, on remantiruyet doma. On trudolubiviy chesniy i otvetstvenniy chelovek. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey, no v budushem razviv svoy bizness i uvelichiv svoi mesachniye doxodi on planiruyet jenitsya. Humbat 23 qoda. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Humbat nujdayetsya v 1000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti remonta domov.
texts.en: Humbat has been working as a repairman, focusing on house repairs, for two years.  He is a hardworking, honest and responsible person.  He is not married and does not have children, but plans to get married in the future, once he is able to develop his business and increase his monthly income.  He lives in the Baku region with his parents.  Humbat needs 1000 AZN to buy necessary tool for his house repair work.

loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy one roll of poplin, some sewing thread and one box of zippers.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo, para que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable y se ha decidido a comprar una maquina la cual la utilizara para medir los gramos de oro,tambien comprara prendas como cadenas, aretes, pulseras, de esa forma lograra que sus ventas mejoren cada día.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le ayudo, porque lo utilizo en comprar prendas de oro, logro surtir y tener más clientes, sus ingresos mejoraron el cual su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan so that her business will always be stable.  She has decided to purchase a machine which she will use to weigh grams of gold.  She will also purchase items such as chains, earrings and bracelets, so that she will have improved sales every day.
Blanca expresses that the previous loan helped her because she used it to purchase gold items and was able to stock up her business and have more customers.  Her income improved, which allowed her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to weigh grams of gold, bracelets and chains.

loans.name: Lum

texts.en:
Lum is married and lives with her two children in Ntarikon, in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon. Challenges she has faced include the death of her father, minimal education due to her family's lack of funds, and the ill health of her children.

With the loan requested, she will buy beans, maize, groundnuts, garri, groundnut oil, onions and magi cubes. She believes that her business will succeed because of her good location, and her knowledge and experience in the business. She provides her community access to a regular supply of items at affordable prices.

She will use the profit from her business for family medication, children's school fees, food, supporting other relatives and expanding her business. She says that a GHAPE loan is preferable because of its low interest rates, convenient time of payment, and education on loan management.

loans.use: to purchase rice, garri, beans, maize, tomatoes and onion.

loans.name: Erisa

texts.en: Erisa is a 23-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a butchery, that he started last year, where he slaughters goats only. He started with capital worth 500,000 shillings and now the business is worth 1,000,000 shillings. His challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and high transportation costs. His dream is building a permanent home and buying land to grow crops. Erisa needs the loan to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктору нужны дополнительные средства, чтобы накрыть теплицы, купить уголь, удобрения. К сожалению из-за инфляции и повышения цен своих средств (полученных с предыдущего сезона) не хватает и каждый год в бизнес нужно вкладывать все больше.

В прошлом году Виктор брал кредит на семена высокорослых помидор, так как они очень дорогие. Это полностью оправдало себя. Ранее Виктор получал 50 тыс грн за сезон, а в прошлом году благодаря кредиту его доход составил 78 тыс грн.

Виктор сделал небольшой ремонт в доме, застеклил крыльцо, поставил хорошие пластиковые окна.
texts.en: Viktor needs additional money to cover greenhouses, buy coal and fertilizers.  Unfortunately, due to inflation and increase in prices, he does not have enough of his own means (earned during the previous season) and has to invest more and more into his business every year.  Last year, Viktor obtained a loan for tall tomato plant seeds because they are very expensive.  That investment completely justified itself.  Previously, Viktor earned 50 thousand hryvnia per season, and last year, thanks to the loan, his income was 78 thousand hryvnia.  Viktor also made minor repairs at home.  He covered his front entrance with glass and installed good, plastic windows.

loans.use: to buy plastic, coal for heating, and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Rufino

texts.es:
José, de nuevo solicita un préstamo debido a la buena atención de nuestra institución y para seguir trabajando en la siembra de frijoles y maíz, necesita comprar los insumos agrícolas como: herbicidas, abono y semilla, de esa forma lograra tener mejores resultados.
El  menciona que el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien puesto que lo invirtió todo en sus cosechas y logro vender una parte y lo demás para los gastos del hogar el cual le ayudaron mucho a su familia.
texts.en:
José is once again asking for a loan to keep working in the planting of beans and corn because of this institution's great service. He needs to buy agricultural goods like herbicides, fertilizer, and seeds. In this way he can achieve better results.

He says that his last loan was very well spent; he put it all towards his crops and was able to sell some, and the rest he used on household expenses, which helped his family a lot.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Azad

texts.ru: Kak vidno na fotografii etot chelovek zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Azad uje 7 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotorix ochen lubit. Azad jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Yemu 38 let. Azad seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. On prodayot moloko i yogurt v magazini Bakinskogo regiona. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy toje zanimayetsya skotovodstvom.
texts.en: As seen on the photograph, this person is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle.  Azad has been involved in this business for seven years.  He is married and has two children, whom he loves very much.  Azad lives in the Baku region together with his friendly family.  He is 38 years old.  Azad needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to develop his business.  He sells milk and yogurt at a store in the Baku region.  He learned this business from his father, who is also involved in animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Jinson Vicente

texts.es:
Jinson Vicente tiene 30 años es casado vive con la esposa, y con los hijos Maicol de 6 y david de 3 años.

La ventanilla se llama CAMINANDO HACIA EL FUTURO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Jesus del Gran Poder, pertenece al canton Ventanas, se dedica a labores agricolas a mantener los cultivos de naranja, guineo, orito, cacao y café.
Jinson se dedica a la agricultura a cuidar las plantaciones de cacao, guineo y naranja ya que estos productos son de ciclo largo, las compras las realiza en el canton Ventanas y las vende en el mismo lugar.

El credito lo solicita para la compra de insumos como: abonos, urea, podas, limpieza del terreno de las malas hiervas y evitar enfermedades en los cultivos. El credito le ayudado a incrementar la calidad de los productos y evitar pérdidas en los cultivos. El sueño de Jinson es comprar un terreno, obtener mas productos y mayor produccion.

Le gusta hacer deporte con su familia y amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jinson Vicente is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children—6 year old Maicol and 3 year old David. 

The group is called Caminando Hacia El Futuro (“Walking Towards the Future.”) It is located in the Jesus del Gran Poder district in the Ventanas canton. It is centered around agricultural labor and the maintenance of the orange, banana, baby orito bananas, cacao and coffee crops. 

Jinson makes a living in agriculture taking care of the coffee, banana, and orange plantations, since these have a longer harvest cycle. He does the purchasing in the Ventanas canton and sells them in the same place. 

He is asking for this loan for the purchase of goods like fertilizer, urea, shears, clearing the land of weeds and getting rid of crop diseases. The loan will help him to increase the quality of the products and avoid losses of crops. His dream is to buy some land, make better products and greater production. 

He likes to play sports with his family and friends from the neighborhood.

loans.use: seeds, goods, fluids, urea and fertilizers

loans.name: Fredis Armando

texts.es:
Fredis, de nuevo solicita un préstamo, para seguir con su negocio y aumentar en capital de trabajo y comprar los materiales necesarios como: madera, tabla y pintura, para poder fabricar los muebles para  venderlos.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior le fue muy bien pues lo invirtió todo en su negocio y pudo entregar los muebles a tiempo a los clientes, le ayudo porque fueron buenos ingresos los que recibio como pago de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Fredis is once again asking for a loan to keep his business going and to increase his business capital and to buy necessary materials like wood, planks, and paint, to be able to make furniture to sell.

He says that he used the last loan very well, since he put it all towards his business and was able to make the furniture for his customers on time. It helped him because he made a good profit as payment for his work.

loans.use: to purchase wood, planks, and paint.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul used the previous loan to pay for labor, pesticides, and mulch for his plantations. He faces hardships such as price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather changes, and theft; however, he still has a goal of hiring employees to help him expand his business. Paul also has the personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent home, and buying a car. He intends to use the loan to pay workers and to buy pesticides, fertilizers, and mulch.

loans.use: to pay workers and to buy pesticides, fertilizers, and mulch.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 47-year-old single mother of four. She is a poultry farmer and has been in the business for the past ten years.

Mary will use the loan amount to purchase poultry feed and pay school fees for her child. She was brought to KADET LTD by another KADET client, and this is her first term loan.
